I bought this wallet because I wanted a lightweight minimalist wallet with the elastic band. Price was right and it’s perfect for my needs.  HOWEVER,  I had a hard time believing it had any RFID protection being so lightweight, and I was right. The wallet’s design is perfect, but a company that blatantly lies needs to be called out.
I liked the idea of the wallet, but in less than  a year (4 months) it already ripped and I cannot use it. Looking for a replacement.
A nice small wallet. Perfect if you don't have a lot to carry. Dries quickly. Without the stretchy strap, everything will fall out.

As others have noted, the elastic band looses stretch over 1 y of use. (Also gets very dirty.) The band is necessary to keep cards from falling out. I'm using this wallet now and it holds all my cards and cash. I used to have a leather front pocket which was basically a leather rectangle that wrapped around my cards but it wasn't made to hold paper bills. This new nylon wallet holds the same amount of cards more securely and can carry bills too. It also fits in the front pocket.  The one issue I've had with it is the credit card pockets don't hold a small amount of cards securely. You need about 5+ cards per pocket or the cards might easily slide out when the wallet is 'open'. When 'closed' the elastic band wraps around and keeps everything secure but in the beginning I had just a few cards in one of the pockets and they all fell out. I rearranged my cards and it's secure now.

I recently bought the **LIGHT FOLD Slim Minimalist Wallet for Men**, and I am thoroughly impressed with its design and functionality. This trifold nylon card holder truly lives up to its promises of being ultra-thin, stylish, and practical.  First off, the **slim and minimalist design** is perfect for my needs. It fits comfortably in my front pocket without creating any bulk, which is a huge plus. Despite its slim profile, this wallet can hold up to **12 cards and cash** with ease. The organization is intuitive, making it easy to access my cards quickly.  The **trifold design** is a great feature. It provides extra security for my cards and cash, and I love how compact it feels. The **nylon material** is both durable and lightweight, ensuring that the wallet will last a long time without adding unnecessary weight to my pocket.  One of the standout features is the **RFID blocking technology**. It gives me peace of mind knowing that my cards are protected from electronic theft. In today's world, this is an essential feature that can't be overlooked.  In addition to its practical features, the **stylish design** of this wallet is another big plus. It looks modern and sleek, making it suitable for both casual and formal settings. The craftsmanship is top-notch, and the attention to detail is evident. I chose the solid black with the green strap and have received lots of compliments.  Overall, the LIGHT FOLD Slim Minimalist Wallet is an excellent purchase. It's functional, stylish, and designed with the modern man in mind. I highly recommend this wallet to anyone looking for a high-quality, ultra-thin card holder that combines style and security perfectly.

I'm approaching middle age, and as such I've tried at least one of most types of wallets out there, from big to small, high tech to low tech, leather to rigid carbon fiber, you name it. Especially the ones listed on Amazon, every time I get a new wallet I scroll dozens of pages into the listings before coming to a decision. I started out as a front-pocket wallet guy and continue to be one so the big wallets didn't usually last very long. They all had flaws, which I'm sure this one does, but I don't think any of them were quite as space-efficient as this one.  I can't talk much about its longevity or durability since I haven't owned it for very long, but I expect I'll probably experience the same logo stitching issue like everyone else. Still, it's a fantastic little wallet and cheap enough that I could just get another one. I carry a small amount of cash because as much as I'd like to go without it, cash is still king in some places. I've loaded about 15 cards into it with three bills in the cash slot and it's about as small as it could possibly get. I keep my ID in the top of the stack in one column, and my two most used cards at the top of the other two columns and I have quick and easy access to the three cards I need on a daily basis.  I noticed that I don't have anywhere to put two restaurant's buy-15-get-one-free-type paper punch cards in. I could put it in the wallet like any other card but I decided to just leave them out and hopefully remember to bring them along when I go. I doubt I will, though. Oh well.

评论概述: Amazingly compact but bad quality materials. It started to rip one day after I opened it.
评论详情: UPDATE - it is NOT RFID protected. One of my cards that never even left my wallet was picked up on the first trip I took using this wallet. With all or most cards having RFID for contactless payments, the lack of this feature on any modern wallet is a big blow to it’s usefulness. I normally use RFID sleeves but those don’t fit on this wallet. I do NOT recommend purchasing it.  Literally one day after I opened it, the elastic band is starting to tear. That's unfortunate as the size of this wallet and the amount of cards and cash it can take (I'm doing 10 cards and 12 bills), while keeping an amazingly small footprint is impressive. I'm still going to use it for as long as the elastic lasts, but this means the $17 price tag comes with a catch and that is poor quality, at least in the elastic band. Also, it says that it offers RFID protection, but I heard on a video review on Youtube that it's just nylon, no additional shielding in between layers. Which if true, not sure how good nylon is for that purpose. I normally carry my cards in RFID protective sleeves, but none of them would fit in the card pockets of this wallet. If they had a more expensive version of this wallet with better quality materials and a proper RFID shielding layer built it, I would get that instead. I'll just say that if you really want a compact wallet but have to carry a bunch of cards and some cash, you won't find a better option than this wallet. Just know that the materials are not the best and may not last as much as you'd like.
Light and compact. Barely notice it's in my pocket. Holds bills well and cards. I recommend putting multiple cards per slot so they fit snug.

评论详情: Definitely a more minimalist wallet and fits well in the hand. I have an AirTag wallet holder that fits great in center slot of the wallet. 评论概述: Not really ideal for practical use
评论详情: It's cute, and the design is super simple, which I like! However, it's beyond flimsy. Yes, it's super light-weight and it unfortunately comes at the cost of practicality. I can crumble it up like a paper wad because there's no backing of any sort anywhere, but I can't actually use it as a wallet reliably.  I can't use more than one pocket for any cards (including ID since there's not any dedicated pocket for that) because they slide out with nothing more than a stiff breeze once the wallet is opened. I've stacked all 6 of my "Cards" (including DL, 2 other IDs and my bank cards) into the center pocket to give it some kind of rigidity and stability and that's questionable at best. I cannot recommend this for travel, practical use, or even "as a backup".  Dunno if design team has eyes on the listing but I'd recommend some non-slip strips along the inside lining of the card pockets. It'll help maintain the lightweight purpose/design while mostly eliminating this current design flaw.
For travel and backpacking, this is the perfect wallet. It is simple, and does what it has to without any frills. I highly recommend it.

this wallet has some good features. it hold cards and cash and does it securely. now i always have space for my spare cash, and receipts if i need to stash them too. i have seen some reviews mention the band fraying or having other issues, but mine has not had any.. i think the elastic band surrounding the wallet is the very best part. at first i worried it would be a hassle, but now it's just another natural movement to slide it off and open the wallet. its also nice to have when standing in a pay line. you can take the card out, and put it in the front, outside the pockets but within the elastic, if that makes sense. the band keeps everything secure, but also nice and compact as well. the waterproof canvas material helps it slide easily in and out of my pocket when needed, but not so it falls out on it own.. you can only put about 9 cards in this wallet, as each pocket only holds about 3, so pare down before your purchase ;) its small, but mighty. i really do love this wallet <3
